data.title: CHATTER: Bryan brothers to be honored at ceremony
data.meta_description: Rio Mesa of Oxnard graduates Bob and Mike Bryan, the top-ranked doubles team in the world, will be honored at a ceremony at 3:30 p.m. today at Plaza Park in Oxnard.The duo, who recently won the U.S. Open title, will also make an announcement about The Bryan Brothers’ foundation, their charity which is holding a […]
data.text:
Rio Mesa of Oxnard graduates Bob and Mike Bryan, the top-ranked doubles team in the world, will be honored at a ceremony at 3:30 p.m. today at Plaza Park in Oxnard.

The duo, who recently won the U.S. Open title, will also make an announcement about The Bryan Brothers’ foundation, their charity which is holding a fund-raising event Saturday at Sherwood Country Club in Thousand Oaks. The Bryans will also be raffling off adidas products.

The Bryan Brothers’ All-Star Tennis Smash will benefit City Impact, an organization promoting the well-being of at-risk families.

C.V.’s Torres selected state’s top athlete

Crescenta Valley of La Crescenta senior Zack Torres, who won the first Pacific League meet Tuesday following a second-place finish in the sweepstakes race Saturday at the Woodbridge Cross Country Classic, has been selected the boys’ state athlete of the week by Dyestatcal.com.

Torres – the top-ranked runner in the state in Div. I – clocked a program-record 14 minutes, 26 seconds to finish runner-up to University City of San Diego’s Mac Fleet (14:22) at Woodbridge and followed with a 15:50 at C.V. Park to win by 21 seconds Tuesday at C.V. Park.

La Canada’s Wheeler to speak at luncheon

La Canada football coach Rich Wheeler and former USC quarterback Tim Green are among the scheduled speakers at 11:30 a.m. today at the Pasadena Quarterbacks luncheon at Brookside Country Club in Pasadena.

Lunch is $25 for members and $30 non-members.

– Erik Boal
